summary: Led Zeppelin was an English rock band formed in 1968, known for their heavy, guitar-driven sound. The band included Robert Plant (vocals), Jimmy Page (guitar), John Paul Jones (bass and keyboards), and John Bonham (drums). They evolved from a band called the Yardbirds and signed with Atlantic Records. Led Zeppelin created eight studio albums in ten years, with significant commercial success. Their music influenced hard rock and heavy metal, and they are one of the best-selling music artists worldwide. After Bonham's death in 1980, the band disbanded.
title: Led Zeppelin
